meanings.definition: A material used to protect a building from moisture and air infiltration.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers installed the housewrap around the house to keep out water and air.
meanings.sent2: The new house had housewrap on its exterior to prevent moisture from seeping in.
meanings.sent3: The housewrap was like a shield, defending the building from sneaky water droplets.
meanings.sent4: The housewrap wrapped the house like a protective hug, keeping it safe from the elements.
meanings.sent5: The bright blue housewrap fluttered in the wind, a colorful barrier against the rain.

meanings.definition: To cover a building with housewrap for insulation.
meanings.sent1: The workers will housewrap the entire building to make it more energy-efficient.
meanings.sent2: It is important to housewrap the house properly to keep it warm in winter.
meanings.sent3: The builders decided to housewrap the building in a cozy blanket of insulation.
meanings.sent4: She housewrapped the old house, wrapping it snugly like a present.
meanings.sent5: The act of housewrapping transformed the drafty building into a cozy home.
